marple package¶

marple.dataset module¶

class marple.dataset.Category(cat_id, pos, cat_json)¶

Bases: marple.dataset.JSONStatObject

json¶
label¶
Returns:category label, if any. Otherwise id.
class marple.dataset.Dataset(*args)¶

Bases: marple.dataset.JSONStatObject

Represents a Dataset object

..todo:: Handle these concepts:
  • href
  • role
  • link
  • note
  • error
add_labels(dim_id, labels)¶

Add a labels to categories of a given dimension.

Parameters:
  • dim_id (str) – id of dimension
  • labels (dict) – A dictionary with category id’s as keys and labels as values. E.g. { “M”: “Male”, “F”: “Female”}
append(dataset_to_append)¶

Append another dataset. Metadata from original dataset will override metadata from appended dataset (e.g. labels).

Dataset_to_append:
 A dataset to append (Dataset)
Returns:self
dimension(dim_id)¶

Get dimension by id

Parameters:dim_id (str) – Id of dimension
Returns:
dimensions¶
Returns:A list of all dimensions as Dimension instances
extension¶

Convenience attribute. :returns: The extension property of the json stat object as dict.

filter(filter_fn, content='index')¶

Transform the dataset to dataframe and apply a filter. :param filter: A function to filter by, e.g. lambda x: x[‘gender’] == ‘M’ :returns: self

filter_by_query(query, content='index')¶

Simple filtering of a dataset. Get all rows that equals a given value. For example dataset.filter_by_query({“region”: “Stockholms kommun”})

Parameters:query (dict) – dimension id as key, value as value e.g. { “gender”: “M” }
Returns:Self
from_dataframe(df, value='value')¶

Parse a Pandas dataframe to a json stat object. Note that the created dataset won’t have any labels, roles, units etc

Parameters:
  • df (pandas.Dataframe) – Data frame with only the columns to be included
  • value (string) – name of value column
Returns:

Itself to chain calls
from_file(file_path)¶

Parse from json file

Parameters:file_path (str) – Path to json file.
Returns:Itself to chain calls
from_json(json_data)¶

Parse a json structure and initialize this dataset

Parameters:json_data – json structure
Dict json_data:dict
Returns:Itself to chain calls
from_string(json_string)¶

Parse a string containing a jsonstat and initialize this dataset

Parameters:json_string (str) – String containing a jsonstat
Returns:Itself to chain calls
json¶
Returns:A json representation of the dataset as dict.
label¶
Returns:The label property of the json stat object as str.
source¶
Returns:The source property of the json stat object as str.
to_dataframe(content='label', value_column='value')¶

Transforms the dataset to a pandas dataframe.

Parameters:
  • content – Can be “label” or “id”. If labels are not defined index will be used instead.
  • value_column – name of value column
Returns:

a list of rows, first line is the header, every row is tuple
to_table(content='label', value_column='value')¶

Transforms a dataset into a table (a list of rows as tuple) Like so: [

(‘region’, u’gender’, ‘value’), (‘Stockholm’, ‘Male’, 1), (‘Stockholm’, ‘Female’, 2), (‘Solna’, ‘Male’, 3), (‘Solna’, ‘Female’, 4)

]

Parameters:
  • content – Can be “label” or “id”. If labels are not defined index will be used instead.
  • value_column – name of value column
Returns:

a list of rows, first line is the header, every row is tuple
updated¶
Returns:The updated property of the json stat object as str.

categories¶

exception marple.dataset.MalformedJSONStat¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

exception marple.dataset.MergeFailure¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

class marple.dataset.meta_property¶

Bases: property

We use this decorator class to define what properties should be preserved when datasets are filtered, extended or modified in some other way. Used for labels, source, extension etc.
